watershed_abstraction Module¶

class wepppy.watershed_abstraction.watershed_abstraction.CentroidSummary(**kwds)¶

Bases: object

exception wepppy.watershed_abstraction.watershed_abstraction.ChannelRoutingError¶

Bases: Exception

THE NETWORK STRUCTURE DELINEATED BY TOPAZ CONTAINS MORE THAN 3 CHANNELS AS INPUT TO A SINGLE CHANNEL. WEPP CAN ONLY HANDLE 3 OR LESS CHANNELS DRAINING INTO A SINGLE CHANNEL.

THE CHANNELS SHOULD BE REDELINEATED AFTER ADJUSTING THE MINIMUM CHANNEL LENGTH (MCL) AND/OR CRITICAL SOURCE AREA (CSA)

write_slps(channels=1, subcatchments=1, flowpaths=1)¶

Writes slope files to the specified wat_dir. The channels, subcatchments, and flowpaths args specify what slope files should be written.

wepppy.watershed_abstraction.watershed_abstraction.centroid_px(indx, indy) → Tuple[int, int]¶

given a sets of x and y indices calulates a central [x,y] index

wepppy.watershed_abstraction.watershed_abstraction.compute_direction(head: List, tail: List) → float¶
wepppy.watershed_abstraction.watershed_abstraction.cummnorm_distance(distance: List[float]) → <built-in function array>¶

builds and returns cummulative normalized distance array from an array of cell-to-cell distances

wepppy.watershed_abstraction.watershed_abstraction.garbrecht_length(distances: List[List[float]]) → float¶

calculates the length of a subcatchment from the flowpaths contained within the subcatchment. The length is weighted_flowpaths by the flowpaths length relative to its area.

distances should be an array of distances between cells along the flowpath (not cummulative distance)

eq. 3.4 in Thomas Cochrane’s Dissertation #

wepppy.watershed_abstraction.watershed_abstraction.interpolate_slp(distances, slopes, max_points)¶

wepppy.watershed_abstraction.watershed_abstraction.representative_normalized_elevations(x: List[float], dy: List[float]) → List[float]¶

x should be a normed distance array between 0 and 1 dy is an array of slopes

returns normalized elevations (relative to the length of x)

wepp_top_translator Module¶

class wepppy.watershed_abstraction.wepp_top_translator.WeppTopTranslator(top_sub_ids, top_chn_ids)¶

Bases: object

Utility class to translate between sub_ids, wepp_ids, and topaz_ids, and chn_enums.

Conventions
sub_id
string in the “hill_%i” % top format
chn_id
string in the “chn_%i” % top format
wepp (a.k.a. wepp_id)
integer wepp id (consecutive)
top (a.k.a. topaz_id)
integer topaz right hillslopes end with 3 left hillslopes end with 2 center hillslopes end with 1 channels end with 4
chn_enum
integer = wepp - hillslope_n
chn_enum(wepp=None, chn_id=None, top=None)¶
has_top(top)¶
is_channel(top=None, wepp=None)¶
iter_chn_ids()¶
iter_sub_ids()¶
iter_wepp_chn_ids()¶
